summary: This document is an email chain from UBS Private Wealth Management discussing a meeting recap with Ghislaine Maxwell regarding her financial affairs. It details her investment plans, assets, and personal financial philosophy, including her desire to have no heirs and die with minimal money.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Client of UBS Private Wealth Management
persons.context: The subject of a meeting recap email discussing her investment of $15 million at JPMorgan, her financial assets, and her personal financial plans including having no heirs.

persons.name: Scott L. Stackman
persons.role: Managing Director - Investments, Private Wealth Advisor at UBS Private Wealth Management
persons.context: Author of the original meeting recap email sent on January 16, 2014, detailing Ghislaine Maxwell's financial discussions and instructions.

persons.name: Dana
persons.role: Assistant or associate of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will provide copies of statements and begin a process for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bill Sutton
persons.context: Person Ghislaine Maxwell would like to be introduced to regarding philanthropy.

persons.name: Lyle Casriel
persons.context: One of the recipients of Scott Stackman's original meeting recap email.

persons.context: One of the recipients of Scott Stackman's original meeting recap email.

connections.description: Stackman is a UBS Private Wealth Advisor providing financial services to Maxwell, as detailed in the meeting recap.
Dana is Maxwell's assistant who will handle obtaining statements and initiating processes for her.
Both are UBS staff members, with Stackman sending the meeting recap to Casriel and others.
Both are recipients of the forwarded 2020 email, likely involved in the same investigation.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Meeting Recap
events.description: A meeting was held between Ghislaine Maxwell and UBS Private Wealth Advisor Scott Stackman to discuss her financial investments, assets, and plans.

events.title: Email Forwarded to Investigators
events.description: The 2014 email recap of the meeting with Ghislaine Maxwell was forwarded to individuals with identifiers suggesting law enforcement or investigative roles.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell had $15 million invested at JPMorgan, with $10 million invested and $5 million in cash, and explicitly stated she did not want any lock-up period for her funds.
Maxwell stated she was signing a deal to make $1-4 million with a hedge fund that uses maritime activity for investment decisions, backed by someone who worked for Obama.
Maxwell expressed a desire to spend $1 million total ($500k then, another $500k later) and wanted to 'die with a Penny' while having no heirs.
Maxwell's company, Terremar, kept cash at UBS, and she considered selling her townhouse for $17 million.
The 2014 financial meeting recap was forwarded in 2020 to individuals with identifiers (G-INV1) suggesting it became part of a law enforcement investigation.
